title: Tom Barling
text:
Henry Thomas Barling (1 September 1906 at <a href="Kensington">Kensington</a>, <a href="London">London</a> – 2 January 1993 at <a href="Hastings">Hastings</a>, <a href="Sussex">Sussex</a>) was an English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er. A right-handed batsman, in a <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> career with <a href="Surrey%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Surrey</a> lasting from 1927 to 1948, he scored 19209 runs at an average of 34.61, with 34 hundreds and a highest score of 269.
During <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, he served in <a href="Coastal%20Command">Coastal Command</a> of the RAF. After retiring from first-class cricket, he was a coach at <a href="Harrow%20School">Harrow School</a> from 1948 to 1966.
